standard_metadata.standard_description: Compare two decimals to hundredths by reasoning about their size. Recognize that comparisons are valid only when the two decimals refer to the same whole. Record the results of comparisons with the symbols >, =, or <, and justify the conclusions, e.g., by using a visual model.

hints.content: $<$ means "is less than."  $>$ means "is greater than."  $=$ means "is the same as."

First, let's use a place value table to turn $\blueD{25 \text{ hundredths}}$ into standard form.  The last place value in the number is *hundredths*, so the number ends in the *hundredths* place.  Ones | $.$ | Tenths | Hundredths :-:|:-: | :-: | :-: | :-:  $\blueD0$ |$.$  | $\blueD2$ | $\blueD5$

Now let's use the place value table to compare our two numbers.  Ones | $.$ | Tenths | Hundredths :-:|:-: | :-: | :-: | :-:  $\blueD0$ |$.$  | $\blueD2$ | $\blueD5$  $\greenD0$| $.$  | $\greenD3$ | $\greenD8$

The greatest place value with different digits is the tenths.    $\blueD{0.25}$ has $\blueD2$ tenths.  $\greenD{0.38}$ has $\greenD3$ tenths.  Since $\blueD{0.25}$ has less tenths, it is less than $\greenD{0.38}$.
$\blueD{25\text{ hundredths}} < \greenD{0.38}$
$<$ means "is less than."  $>$ means "is greater than."  $=$ means "is the same as."

First, let's use a place value table to turn $\greenD{5 \text{ tenths and }4\text{ hundredths}}$ into standard form.  Ones | $.$ | Tenths | Hundredths :-:|:-: | :-: | :-: | :-:  $\greenD0$ |$.$  | $\greenD5$ | $\greenD4$

Now let's use the place value table to compare our two numbers.  Ones | $.$ | Tenths | Hundredths :-:|:-: | :-: | :-: | :-:  $\blueD0$ |$.$  | $\blueD8$ | $\blueD2$  $\greenD0$| $.$  | $\greenD5$ | $\greenD4$

The greatest place value with different digits is the tenths.    $\blueD{0.82}$ has $\blueD8$ tenths.  $\greenD{0.54}$ has $\greenD5$ tenths.  Since $\blueD{0.82}$ has more tenths, it is greater than $\greenD{0.54}$.
$\blueD{0.82} > \greenD{5\text{ tenths and }4\text{ hundredths}}$
$<$ means "is less than."  $>$ means "is greater than."  $=$ means "is the same as."

All the digits in $\blueD{88\text{ hundredths}}$ and $\greenD{0.88}$ are the same so they are equal.
$\blueD{88\text{ hundredths}} = \greenD{0.88}$
$<$ means "is less than."  $>$ means "is greater than."  $=$ means "is the same as."
